snippet: House Republicans, whose constituents do not want their taxes raised, are faced with the pitch that increasing taxes for the affluent will help the nation over all.
abstract: House Republicans find themselves caught between will of larger American public that favors higher taxes on the rich and wishes of constituents who reelected them overwhelmingly to oppose Pres Obama's agenda at every turn.
lead_paragraph: House Republicans, whose constituents do not want their taxes raised, are faced with the pitch that increasing taxes for the affluent will help the nation over all.

headline.seo: In Talks, House Majority Weighs Loyalty to Voters
headline.main: In Talks, House Majority Weighs Loyalty to Voters
headline.print_headline: In Talks, House Majority Weighs Loyalty to Voters
